content.prompt: Which of the following describes the Chinese government's policy regarding the development of Special Economic Zones (SEZs) ?

choices.label: The Chinese government remained hands-off and had no control over the establishment of the SEZs.
The Chinese government curtailed human rights abuses to promote the development of SEZs.
The Chinese government stopped the development of SEZs to focus on a centrally planned economy.
The Chinese government encouraged market-oriented economic reforms and promoted SEZs.
